intro: Calandrinia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, vibrant red or orange flowers that resemble small lanterns, hence its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Calandrinia mexicana is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
